source.de6f8be2:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Pie chart, where the slices will be ordered and plotted counter-clockwise:
labels = "Yes", "No"
sizes = [100-52.38, 52.38]
explode = (0, 0)  # only "explode" the 2nd slice (i.e. 'Hogs')

fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots()
ax1.pie(sizes, explode=explode, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%',
        shadow=True, startangle=90)
ax1.axis('equal')  # Equal aspect ratio ensures that pie is drawn as a circle.

plt.show()

source.1fe93ad9:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Pie chart, where the slices will be ordered and plotted counter-clockwise:
labels = "Yes", "No"
sizes = [100-42.85, 42.85]
explode = (0, 0)  

fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots()
ax1.pie(sizes, explode=explode, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%',
        shadow=True, startangle=90)
ax1.axis('equal')  # Equal aspect ratio ensures that pie is drawn as a circle.

plt.show()

source.d16d6f71:
Here, we can see that the pitch in Hambantota supported the batsman in the first innings, while the pitches of Ahmedabad and Colombo gave the best support to the bowlers compared to other grounds.
(Here, Chennai and Delhi are exceptions as only one match was played there.)
source.6e4bb5d1: ## Now the overall conclusion is that the pitch in the first innings in the Group B matches had a huge advantage for batsman, as we saw that on an average, 49.4 overs were played and 274 runs were scored, which is pretty good for the batting side. And the wickets which fell, are maybe because the batsmen tried to take the max. advantage of the flat tracks, and hence lost wickets in the process. But it didn't matter much for the batting team as they scored huge runs.
source.2d34fdec: Here, we can see that the run rate was almost 4.9, which contradicts to our above data a bit.
source.96538acd: # Now, the overall conclusion here is the pitch had a huge advantage for the bowlers, where in the second innings, only 37.5 overs were played on an average, 6 wickets fell(avg.) in the second innings and the average score was only 175.
source.d74a26a8: We can clearly see here that at an average, 7 wickets fell in the first innings, while the min. wickets fell in 1st innings is 3. Also, we saw above that the average run rate was almost 5. So, it can be concluded that the bowlers had an advantage over the batsmen.
source.f4d882de: # Now, the overall conclusion is that in the second innings, the pitch was neither supporting the bowlers much nor the batsmen. On an average, 288 runs were made each innings, but also, 7 wickets fell and only 41 overs were played.
source.d295fdbd: Here, we can see the mix of both data. Here, some pitches like Bengaluru, Nagpur and Kolkata supported batsmen very much, while pitches like Mohali and Chittagong had a neutral nature towards both batsmen and bowlers.
source.0df6749f: # Exploratory Data Analysis on 2011 Cricket World Cup
source.a34dcc63:
Here we can see that all the grounds except Colombo had a second innings run rate of less than or equal to six(in multiple matches).
Chennai is an exceptional case as they only had to chase 72 and that too against Kenya.
source.7a69e1a3: Many people will wonder that why I used median instead of mean here to find the average score. This is because there was an exceptional score of 58 which acts as an outlier in the dataset. While mean considers it, median doesn't consider these type of outliers.
source.7fa6b85b: Here, we can see that the average run rate in 1st innings was slightly above 5, according to this we can say that in the first innings, the bowlers had a very slight advantage over the batsmen.
source.2343d1b2: Here, we can see that on an average, 41 overs were played in the second innings.
source.d3b61580: # Are toss winners, the match winners?
source.f090a90a: ## Now, the overall conclusion here is the pitch had a sort of advantage for the bowlers, where in the first innings, 46 overs were played in an average, but on an average, 7 wickets fell in the first innings and the average score was only 239.
source.55e6e0ab: In the first innings of Group B matches, the average score was 272, which is a pretty good score for batting side, the score had also reached the maximum of 370.
source.d3596bfd: The average score in the second innings was 174, which is a pretty low score for a ODI match. Also the maximum score reached was 266, which is just 27 more than the average score of first innings
source.b68f86bd: Now, the average score was 239(approx.) in the first innings, with the highest score being 358.

source.e72b7a53:
The 2011 ICC Cricket World Cup was the tenth Cricket World Cup. It was played in India, Sri Lanka, and (for the first time) Bangladesh. India won the tournament, defeating Sri Lanka by 6 wickets in the final at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai, thus becoming the first country to win the Cricket World Cup final on home soil. India's Yuvraj Singh was declared the man of the tournament. This was the first time in World Cup history that two Asian teams had appeared in the final. It was also the first time since the 1992 World Cup that the final match did not feature Australia.

Fourteen national cricket teams took part in this tournament, including 10 full members and four associate members of the International Cricket Council (ICC)

source.27c74fb5: #### My overall conclusion for the match: Sri Lankans played a decent innings and the batting of Mahela Jayawardene was a joy to watch.  Sangakkara also played a good innings of 48, and Perera's cameo added more spice to the innings. The wickets of Sehwag and Sachin in quick succession almost shattered every Indian's dream. But that day Gambhir and Dhoni had other plans. Their partnership of 103 was exceptional. Also the initial partnership of Gambhir with Kohli was also very important for the Indians. And then finally Dhoni finished the innings in style with a wonderful six. But that day, another player had played a very important role who's not given much credit. He's Yuvraj Singh. He took the two very important wickets of Samaraweera and the in-form skipper Sanga. Or else, the score may have crossed 300, and it would have added more difficulties to the run chase.

source.fddf92fe: In this project, I'll do an EDA on the prestigious 2011 CWC. There will be analysis starting from the group stages, the knockouts, the finals, player-wise stats and much more.All of the datasets used in this project are my hand-framed datasets which I have made using MS Excel 2016. Note that although I'm a huge cricket fan, I've mad this project from a lay man's point of view, who just knows the rules of cricket, and hasn't watched any of the matches of the 2011 WC. So, lets start
